topics.body:
Talking about guilty gear xrd, but I watched the story mode.  I actually don't understand how people who like fighting games can dislike it. . . other than people who hate anime.


Speaking of guilty gear xrd; you know what?  I would not mind if cgi were to overtake anime *IF* it were done as well as guilty gear xrd.  The problem with cgi in anime is that the people who use it are not familiar with cgi so or the models aren't consistent or it's done as a last resort so the 3d models are extremely low resolution.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bdd84e6368722aeb7f0800#post_54bdd84e6368722aeb7f0800
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bdd8116368726c51940900#post_54bdd8116368726c51940900
Damn are you serious?!

Its THAT God?! [/bq]
!http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/666/649/981.gif!
The plot of the story is really damn good; nothing is rushed, nothing is slowed down, not a single god damn plot hole at all, almost all the loose ties are wrapped up and it leaves on a good cliffhanger to foreshadow the next game.

The last minute of the game a lot of shit just clicks.
There's a part in which you realize who Valentine actually is that you go ". . . oh! OH! OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOH!  Everything makes sense!"

From a technical standpoint there's a lot of moments where you can see that they're trying to squeeze out every last cent of the budget to make sure that the story isn't rushed, but I think it was a good choice in this case cause those corners they cut on animating certain parts were put into the important parts and such.  It's literally a 4 hour anime.

!http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/836/516/411.gif!
